content: get creative and express yourself with these delightful dolls these cuties were designed for universal yarn by jacki donhou and they use six of our new colors of bamboo pop to celebrate the diversity of our skin tones each doll features playful hair styles and unique accessories they re perfect as sweet décor or toys for your little one you can try to just make one but we re pretty sure you won t be able to resist making them all **skill** crochet **difficulty** easy **sizes** one size **finished measurements** height approx 6½ tall **materials** **universal yarn** *bamboo pop* 1 50% bamboo 50% cotton 100g/292 yds note if you intend to make multiple dolls please note that purchasing a second ball of any color duplicated below is not necessary note 2 the total yardage requirements sewing pins removable stitch markers 2 pipe cleaners black crochet thread or embroidery floss sew on snaps size 4/0 sewing needle and thread clear elastic hair ties **gauge** 32 single_crochet x 32 rnds = 4 save time check your gauge **pattern notes** these dolls are created modularly with minimal seaming by first creating two arms and setting them aside then the body is made seamlessly by making one leg then joining a second leg to it before working in the round for the body the arms are attached while working rounds of the body before moving on to shoulder and neck shaping then finally the head ears are made and sewn on separately lastly facial features are embroidered on to finish the doll you will work in unjoined continuous rounds to track them place a removable stitch marker in the first stitch to denote the beginning of each round you will move the marker up each round after completing the first stitch of each new round this pattern uses a shorthand style of crochet instructions abbreviation descriptions and instructions are given in the stitch guide 1 https //universalyarn com/products/bpopn
